Ordi nary Time Dt 3010 14 Ps 6914 17 30 31 33 34 36 37 or Ps 198 11 Col 115 20 Lk 1025 37 Fourteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time July 6 2025 Welcome to all those joining us for the Fourth of July Holiday whether you are with us while visiting family or camping at the State Park May you have a blessed and relaxing holiday and know that you are always welcome at St Joseph's This weekend July 5th 6th the Church celebrates the Fourteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time It is the first Sunday since the beginning of March that we are now back to wearing the green of Ordinary Time We will remain in this season throughout the next five months until the liturgical year ends with the Solemnity of Jesus Christ King of the Universe and a new year in God's grace begins with the start of Advent Our journey through the remaining twenty Sundays of Ordinary Time will unfold with a steady rhythm broken only by two meaningful interludes On September 14th we will celebrate the Solemnity of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross and on November 2nd the Commemoration of All the Faithful Departed Though these days may seem distinct they draw us to a singular truth The hope we share in Christ's triumph over death The flow of the liturgical year is meant to remind us that the Church is alive The liturgical year like our life is a journey It walks with us through every season of life For this reason the year shifts in color tone and rhythm From Advent's preparation to Christmas joy from Lent's sorrow to Easter triumph Even in the quiet of Ordinary Time as we are learning how to live The Church is big enough for all of it for all of life in Christ for our life As we enter back into Ordinary Time we continue our journey through the St Luke's Gospel We are now picking up in the tenth chapter of the Gospel placing us at Jesus final journey His fateful death march toward Jerusalem that formally began in Luke 951 Yet despite the foreshadowing of His coming suffering and death that immediately preceded our Gospel reading this Sunday finds us temporarily caught up in the joy of Jesus ministry In sending out and receiving back His disciples Jesus forms around Himself a spiritual Jerusalem a community called to embody peace and restoration Through their healing ministry they fulfill the ancient prophecies of the Lord's holy city Though often overshadowed by the Twelve the seventy two disciples played a vital role in God's plan anticipating the Church's wider mission of service spiritual authority and radical trust in divine providence St Joe Cooks 150th Anniversary Cookbook After months of hard work our parish's anniversary cookbook is hot off the presses Celebrating our 150th Parish Anniversary and serving as a follow up to the 2000 Cooking with Saint Joseph the Cookbook Committee is proud to present St Joe Cooks special Thank You to Lori Bender Beth Gordon and Sherry Makowski for leading this joyful project and to all who shared recipes and stories that made this collection so meaningful St Joe Cooks will be available for purchase after all Masses the weekend of July 19th and 20th Stop by the narthex after Masses that weekend to grab your copy and enjoy a few tasty samples prepared from recipes in the book In honor of our 150th Parish Anniversary St Joe Cooks will be sold for 15 Proceeds will help cover printing costs with any remaining funds supporting our upcoming parish renovations Totus Tuus Summer Youth Program July 20th 25th Our Totus Tuus Catholic Summer Youth Program is quickly approaching From July 20th to 25th we will welcome four college age missionaries who will lead an engaging faith filled week for our youth and teens Our missionaries will speak at all Masses the weekend of July 19th and 20th to share more about the Totus Tuus experience The 7th 12th Grade program will kick off on Sunday evening July 20th with the 1st 6th Grade program beginning the following morning Monday July 21st We encourage all the youth of our parish to take part in this joyful week of faith friendship and fun Faithfully in Christ Fr David Weekend of July 12th 13th MASSES Cantors 5:00pm Sam Smith 7:30am Teresa Smith 10:00am Jay Crisp Lectors 5:00pm Dan Geimer 7:30am
